intro: Microchilus trianae, commonly known as the Trianas' mistletoe, is a hemiparasitic plant native to the Caribbean. It belongs to the family Viscaraceae and typically grows on the branches of host trees such as mangroves and other tropical hardwoods. The plant has small, leathery leaves and produces tiny, white or pale yellow flowers. Its fruits are small berries that contain seeds dispersed by birds. Microchilus trianae plays a role in the ecological dynamics of its habitat by influencing host tree growth and providing food for various wildlife species.
